title: A Backwards Composition Context Based Service Selection Approach for Service Composition
abstract:
The full text of this paper is not available on the LRA. The original publication is available from the publisher's website at: http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/xpl/mostRecentIssue.jsp?punumber=5283889 ' DOI: 10.1109/SCC.2009.25In SOA applications are built from individual services\ud
offered by different providers. Typically an application comprises\ud
of several such services usually stemming from different\ud
providers leading to the question of which services to select and\ud
compose. We present the new concept of composition context\ud
together with a novel service selection algorithm. The approach\ud
has been evaluated in our test bed and shows good scalability

The full text of this paper is not available on the LRA. The original publication is available from the publisher's website at: http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/xpl/mostRecentIssue.jsp?punumber=5283889 ' DOI: 10.1109/SCC.2009.25</dc:description><dc:description>
In SOA applications are built from individual services\ud
offered by different providers. Typically an application comprises\ud
of several such services usually stemming from different\ud
providers leading to the question of which services to select and\ud
compose. We present the new concept of composition context\ud
together with a novel service selection algorithm. The approach\ud
has been evaluated in our test bed and shows good scalability.</dc:description><dc:date>
